meanings.definition: To make someone feel nervous or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected noise willied the cat.
meanings.sent2: She willied her friend by hiding behind the door and jumping out.
meanings.sent3: The spooky movie willied the audience, making them jump in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds willied the children, causing them to run indoors.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm willied the dog, making it hide under the bed.

meanings.definition: To play a prank or joke on someone.
meanings.sent1: He willied his sister by putting a fake spider in her bed.
meanings.sent2: The students willied their teacher by switching his markers with crayons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf willied Santa by wrapping his sleigh in toilet paper.
meanings.sent4: The comedian willied the audience with his hilarious stand-up routine.
meanings.sent5: The kids willied their parents by setting up a fake bug on the kitchen counter.

meanings.sent1: After drinking too much, he willied and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: The party guests willied on champagne and danced all night.
meanings.sent3: The bear willied on the fermented berries and stumbled around the forest.
meanings.sent4: The sailors willied on rum before setting sail on their adventure.
meanings.sent5: The friends willied on margaritas and laughed uncontrollably at silly jokes.
